alert.note: Alert for Coastal Levy; Inland Levy (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 11:31AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Levy County through 1215 PM EDT... At 1131 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles south of Horseshoe Point, or 34 miles southwest of Chiefland, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chiefland, Bronson, Fowlers Bluff, Andrews, Manattee Road, East Bronson, Williston Highlands, Otter Creek and Manatee Springs State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
